intro: Juno planifolia, commonly known as the flat-leaved junco, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetland or riparian habitats. Juno planifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
